Ingredients.9: 1 (2 1/2 pound) uncooked prepared beef, veal and pork meatloaf

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

Directions.2: Melt butter in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in mushrooms and a pinch of salt; cook and stir until mushrooms begin to brown, about 5 minutes.

Directions.3: Stir in fresh rosemary. Add flour and stir to coat the mushrooms; cook and stir for about 3 minutes.

Directions.4: Whisk in beef broth, 1/2 cup at a time, whisking constantly to prevent lumps.

Directions.5: Turn heat to high and bring the sauce to a simmer. Simmer a few minutes until sauce starts to thicken. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Directions.6: Remove from heat and stir in heavy cream.

Directions.7: Slide prepared meatloaf into the sauce. Spoon sauce over the top of the meatloaf.

Directions.8: Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 1 1/2 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

Directions.9: Remove pan from the oven and gently remove meatloaf to a serving platter.

Directions.10: Skim off any extra fat from the surface of the sauce.

Directions.11: Bring the sauce to a boil over medium-high heat to reduce until thick, about 5 minutes.
